required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Application of PEGylated Recombinant Human Granulocyte Stimulating Factor Injection (PEG-rhG-CSF) in Chemotherapy of Elderly Lymphoma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center, Open, One-arm Clinical Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Pegylated Recombinant Human Granulocyte-stimulating Factor Injection (PEG-rhG-CSF) in Preventing Neutropenia in Elderly Patients With Lymphoma After Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: A multicenter, open, one-arm clinical study evaluated the efficacy and safety of Jinyouli in preventing neutropenia after chemotherapy in elderly lymphoma patients who met the criteria for admission. Chemotherapy regimen: The investigator selected according to the specific condition the corresponding standard chemotherapy regimen, the chemotherapy regimen used, FN risk ≥ 20%, or 10% < FN risk < 20% with at least one high risk factor for FN, from the first cycle of chemotherapy, 24-72 after chemotherapy hour subcutaneous injection of Jinyouli.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of febrile neutropenia in cycles 1 to 6
primary_outcome.time_frame: through 1-6 cycles of PEG-rhG-CSF,an average of 6 month
primary_outcome.description: The body temperature standard for neutropenic fever is sputum temperature; febrile neutropenia is defined as ANC < 0.5*109 / L and sputum temperature> 38.0 ° C.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of grade IV neutropenia in the first to sixth cycles of PEG-rhG-CSF.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through 1-6 cycles of PEG-rhG-CSF,an average of 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of grade IV neutropenia in the first to sixth cycles of PEG-rhG-CSF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of dose adjustment of chemotherapy drugs in each chemotherapy cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through 1-6 cycles of PEG-rhG-CSF,an average of 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of dose adjustment of chemotherapy drugs in each chemotherapy cycle

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of chemotherapy delays in each chemotherapy cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through 1-6 cycles of PEG-rhG-CSF,an average of 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of chemotherapy delays in each chemotherapy cycle

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients receiving antibiotics during the entire chemotherapy period.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through 1-6 cycles of PEG-rhG-CSF,an average of 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients receiving antibiotics during the entire chemotherapy period.

arm_group.description: Jin Youli(PEG-rhG-CSF):From the first cycle of chemotherapy, Jin Youli(PEG-rhG-CSF) was injected subcutaneously 24-72 hours after the end of chemotherapy, 6 mg was given to patients with body weight ≥45 kg, and 3 mg was given for body weight <45 kg. Inject once every chemotherapy cycle.

intervention.description: The test drug PEG-rhG-CSF was administered prophylactically to elderly lymphoma patients who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria 24-72 hours after chemotherapy.
